text: I'm Ross Katz and I directed adult
beginners so this was shot in New
Rochelle and it's it was freezing cold
that's Jake played by Nick Kroll and
it's his first day as a nanny he's not
an experienced nanny he's a narcissistic
entrepreneur whose company has fallen
apart and the only way he can get his
sister Rose Byrne and Bobby Cannavale II
her husband to agree to let him stay
with them is by agreeing to watch their
child instead of sending their child to
daycare so he brings the kid to the park
the thing is he couldn't get the
stroller open he couldn't figure out how
to open the stroller so he grabbed a
suitcase and rolled the kid in a
suitcase which made a lot of the other
nannies raise their eyebrows they grow
up so fast nothing just playing their
own little boy the actress in the scene
is Paula Garces she's wonderful and
Jake's character felt that he would go
to the park and be with a bunch of
nannies he didn't realize that some of
the nannies might be hot and in this
case the nanny is quite unique Pato and
he tries very unsuccessfully to flirt
with her and this is one of those scenes
that made me laugh when I read it on the
page and I wanted it to be funny and I
wanted it to be warm and I wanted to
show that while Jake is a narcissist and
completely interested in his own life
only he is trying to take care of the
kid you know part of the design of the
film is that I didn't want to make a
kind of indie shaky-cam movie and this
scene is a good example we always were
striving for kind of elegant dolly moves
so that we never had to apologize for
the size of the film and we never had to
apologize for the budget of the film
that we were making maybe not your sort
of typical indie look
